Models.py¶

class apps.scorecard.models.Frame(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a bowling frame, which consists of two turns per frame. A scorecard will have between 10 and 12 frames

class apps.scorecard.models.Game(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The game model is essentially the root model of the application, and represents a bowling game

class apps.scorecard.models.IntegerRangeField(verbose_name=None, name=None, min_value=None, max_value=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Custom field type to support max/min integer values

class apps.scorecard.models.ScoreCard(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a score card (i.e.player) with aggregated metrics about a player’s performance in a game

Managers.py¶

class apps.scorecard.managers.FrameManager[source]¶

Provides table-level functionality to the Frame model.

calculate_frames(active_frame)[source]¶

Runs through all frames related to a particular score card, and calculates the score for each frame.

Parameters:active_frame (object) – The active frame being bowled
Returns:queryset - list of Frame objects for a particular scorecard, ordered according to framenumber
create_bonus_frame(request, active_frame, active_card)[source]¶

creates a bonus frame, where frame_num > 10.

Parameters:
  • request – the http request object
  • active_frame (object) – the current frame being bowled
  • active_card (object) – the current card being bowled
Returns:

object - the newly created bonus frame
frame_count(active_card)[source]¶

Counts number of frames related to a particular scorecard.

Parameters:active_card (object) – The active scorecard being bowled
Returns:int - count of frames related to active_card
make_frames(score_card)[source]¶

Auto-creates 10 frame objects related to a given ScoreCard

Parameters:score_card (object) – The Score Card each new frame will relate to
Returns:True
next_player_and_frame(request, player_count, active_card)[source]¶

This function determines which scorecard and frame objects are the next to be active. Save these values to the session.

Parameters:
  • request – the htt prequest object
  • active_card (object) – the active scorecard being bowled
Request type:

http request object
Player_count:

the number of players (scorecards) in the game
Returns:

object – returns the session object
class apps.scorecard.managers.GameManager[source]¶

Provides table-level functionality to the Game model.

active(request)[source]¶

Returns the current (active) game being played. The function first attempts to pull the game_hash from the session. If that fails then it falls back to pulling the most-recently created game in the database. For a more fail-safe implementation, a better approach is to tie a game to a particular user and cache the game and user in the session. But, it goes beyond the scope of this exercise.

Parameters:request – HTTP request
Request type:object
class apps.scorecard.managers.ScoreCardManager[source]¶

Provides table-level functionality to the ScoreCard model.

calc_rankings(game)[source]¶

Calculates each player’s ranking and updates players’ scorecards accordingly

Parameters:game (object) – The game we want information about
Returns:bool – True if the function executed completely
player_count(game)[source]¶

Returns number of players in the game.

Parameters:game (object) – The game we want information about
Returns:int – the number of players in the game
player_ranking(game)[source]¶

Returns a queryset of the game’s players in order of their total scores and player name

Param:The game we want information about
Returns:queryset - A list of ScoreCard objects in order of their total scores
players(game)[source]¶

Returns the sorecards of all the players in the active game.

Parameters:game (object) – The game we want the scorecards from
Returns:queryset – a list of ScoreCard objects

Views.py¶

View Modules

  • newgame – create new game in the db
  • addplayers – add players to the newgame
  • gameboard – the view for active games, which direct users to take turns
  • gamestats – a ranking board that is displayed when the game is complete
apps.scorecard.views.add_players(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View that enables users to enter the players of the game. An infinite number of players can be added to the game. once at least one player is added to the game, the game is ready to start.

Forms.py¶

class apps.scorecard.forms.BowlForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A model form used to record the number of pins knocked down by a player.

class Meta[source]¶

Specifies that the frame model is used. Fields displayed: down_pins1, down_pins2

model¶

alias of Frame

BowlForm.clean()[source]¶

Validates the combined of down_pins1 and down_pins2 in a frame. Ensures that the total number of knocked-down pins in a frame does not exceed 10

Parameters:self – The form
BowlForm.save(active_frame)[source]¶

Save the frame form, and updates the values of the active frame.

Parameters:
  • self – the form
  • active_frame (object) – The frame currently being bowled by the player
Returns:

object – the updated active frame
class apps.scorecard.forms.NewScoreCardForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A Model Form that allows users to add new score cards during initial game setup. This form only asks user to input the new player’s name

Note

For those not familiar, this is a crispy form’s implementation, which requires some of the form’s display logic be handled in Form.__init__(). For more info, check the docs at http://django-crispy-forms.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

save(game, order)[source]¶

Saves the newly-created ScoreCard object

Parameters:
  • game (object) – The current game being set up
  • order (int) – The order the player will be in the game
Returns:

object – Newly-created scorecard object

Decorators.py¶

apps.scorecard.decorators.new_game_session(_view)[source]¶

Ensures any previous game’s session variables are re-set to None before starting a new game.

:param _view:the view function to be wrapped :type _view: function :returns: wrapper function

apps.scorecard.decorators.session_required(_view)[source]¶

Ensures that the proper session data exists. If if doesn’t, this decorator will create the initial session data required for the game.

Parameters:_view – the view function to be wrapped
Returns:wrapper function
